moves.1. e4:
KGA - one of my better games.

I used to have a lot of trouble with this defence - I would get myself in big trouble early by not developing pieces quickly enough.
moves.1... e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 Bg7: I like this move.... it develops the B, prepares for castling and helps defend the centre. As you can see later, the black bishop plays a key role in tying up white's pieces
moves.5. d4 d6 6. O-O h6 7. c3 Nc6: Reasonably standard so far - the defence is looking reasonably solid
moves.8. b4 Nf6 9. Nbd2 a6: Important to prevent the white B from changing the point of attack
moves.10. Bb2: I don't know that this is white's best move - he is starting to get himself cramped
moves.10... O-O 11. Qc2 Ng4: The key move. White is now in a bit of trouble - he's cramped on the left and will struggle to move his pieces back to defend an attack on the K
moves.12. Rfe1 Ne3 13. Qb3 g4: White now has to choose whether to give up a piece, or completely cramp its pieces with d5
moves.14. d5 Ne5 15. Nxe5 Bxe5: and here's why I like the earlier B move - white is in trouble with its bishops and Q now blocked by its own pawns
moves.16. Nf1 Qh4 17. Nxe3 fxe3 18. g3 Bxg3: When I played this - I still hadn't worked out how the game finishes..... but it seemed like a sensible sacrifice
